channel.title: Modern

item.title: Modern
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

If you only set the variable, of course nothing will happen -.-. Since it is no method which switches your spellbook. So you need to call the sidebar interface method too. You only set that variable so your save file stores the new spellbook.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:5, topic:422920”][quote author=youridudock link=topic=525583.msg3826605#msg3826605 date=1322246375]

if(playerCommand.startsWith("modern")) { c.playerMagicBook = 0; c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); //modern c.sendMessage("Your @blu@Magic @bla@book is now modern."); } else if(playerCommand.startsWith("ancient")) { c.playerMagicBook = 1; c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // ancient c.sendMessage("Your @blu@Magic @bla@book is now ancient."); }

I went ahead and added what the ancient one would look to.

Yh just like I said, c.playerMagicBook = 0;
[/quote]He also forgot to set the sidebar interface.[/quote]

Oh ok, Idk PI

Read full topic

item.title: Modern
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("modern")) { c.playerMagicBook = 0; c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); //modern c.sendMessage("Your @blu@Magic @bla@book is now modern."); } else if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("ancient")) { c.playerMagicBook = 1; c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // ancient c.sendMessage("Your @blu@Magic @bla@book is now ancient."); }

I went ahead and added what the ancient one would look to. And changed it too equalsIgnoreCase.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

I’m trying to make a command to switch spellbook but it won’t work, it send the message but doesn’t change the book, this is my command.

		if(playerCommand.startsWith("modern")) {
		c.playerMagicBook = 1;
		c.sendMessage("Your @blu@Magic @bla@book is now modern.");
		}

What do I do?

Read full topic
